thread.title: Chicago Cubs release tribute video for pitcher Travis Wood
thread.title_full: Chicago Cubs release tribute video for pitcher Travis Wood

title: Chicago Cubs release tribute video for pitcher Travis Wood
text:
Manage Chicago Cubs release tribute video for pitcher Travis Wood The Cubs released a tribute video for former Chicago pitcher Travis Wood, who signed with the Kansas City Royals on Wednesday. 
The Cubs released a tribute video for former Chicago pitcher Travis Wood, who signed with the Kansas City Royals on Wednesday. 
The team thanked the left-hander for all the special moments he provided. 
Thank you to World Series Champion Travis Wood for all the moments only he could provide. pic.twitter.com/mk4XVRCY1b â€” Chicago Cubs (@Cubs) February 15, 2017 
Wood spent the last five seasons with the Cubs after a trade from the Cincinnati Reds in 2011. The left-handed specialist posted a 4-0 record with a 2.95 ERA in 77 appearances, a career high, last season. He appeared in nine postseason games, and allowed two runs over 6 1/3 innings while striking out seven. 
The pitcher's free agent deal with the Royals is for two seasons with $12 million guaranteed. There is also a mutual $8.5 million option between the parties for the 2019 campaign. Author
